activities.loc: Br 3 - Law Enforcement Center - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler K Ward

records.addlTxt:
9:47 AM Defendant Tyler K Ward in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
State makes statements on the record. State indicates the defendant is in a diversion program. State puts the offer on the record regarding successful completion of the diversion program. 
Defendant indicates he was not aware he is in the diversion program. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on January 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No violent contact with the Residents and Employees of the group home (person, property, residence or family).

2:23 PM Defendant Tyler K Ward appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Tyler K Ward.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, not guilty plea entered, bond set.
